title: Salt imports run into a muddle
byline: The government’s efforts to resolve the salt crisis is running into a muddle with importers citing concerns that sufficient stocks cannot be imported within the stipulated time, particularly due to non-availability stocks in the southern part of India which is the closest market for Sri Lanka at the moment.

title: No prior notice from Katunayake apparel factory regarding closure: Minister
byline: The management of the Katunayake apparel factory had not made a prior notice to the labour Department of its closure nor discussed with the government about reasons to close down the factory, Acting Minister of Labour Mahinda Jayasinghe said today.

title: Mahela Jayawardena warns public about fake AI ads using his name
byline: Former Sri Lankan cricket captain Mahela Jayawardena has warned people about fake advertisements created using AI that misuse his name and photograph.

title: Japan’s farm minister resigns over rice gaffe
byline: An off-the-cuff remark about never paying for rice has cost Japan’s agriculture minister his job, as pressure mounts on the government to solve the nation’s rice crisis.

title: CEB proposes 2nd electricity tariff revision for 2025, public consultations to follow
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has formally submitted a proposal for a second electricity tariff revision for the year 2025, marking another adjustment to the country’s power pricing structure within the year.

title: Five of one family in hospital-Pet Dog waiting for them
byline: In another shocking episode in Gerandiella fatal bus accident that caused the death of 23 passengers and serious injuries to several others, five members of one family have been among the victims.

title: CSE closes higher amid cautious trading ahead of policy decision
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed on a mixed outlook today. Market activity remained subdued, with dull momentum prevailing throughout the day, as investors largely adopted a wait-and-see approach ahead of the monetary policy announcement scheduled for tomorrow by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka.

title: Over 1,000 killed in road accidents in five months: Police to act on unsafe vehicles
byline: A total of 1,000 people have died due to road accidents in the past five months, according to the Department of Government Information.

title: Woman nabbed at BIA with foreign cigarette haul worth over Rs. 6 million
byline: A Sri Lankan female passenger was arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) by airport customs officers this morning for attempting to smuggle in a consignment of foreign-made cigarettes worth over Rs. 6 million into the country.

title: Will new Auditor General be a political appointee?: Harsha questions
byline: A person who had send in an application for the post of Auditor General is to be appointed to the post, MP Harsha de Silva alleged in Parliament today.

title: Some 40,000 teacher vacancies in the country: Harini
byline: There are some 40,000 teacher vacancies in government schools across the country, Prime Minister and Education Minister Harini Amarasuriya said today.

title: Transport Ministry to establish passenger committees from July 1
byline: The Transport Ministry has announced plans to establish passenger committees on selected bus routes, with effect from July 1, in a move aimed at empowering commuters and improving public transport services.

title: CC rejects President’s nominee for Auditor General’s Post
byline: The Constitutional Council (CC) has rejected President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s nominee for the post of Auditor General, reliable sources told Daily Mirror.

title: Tottenham defeat Manchester United to win Europa League final
byline: Brennan Johnson scores the only goal as Tottenham beat Man Utd to lift the cup and qualify for the Champions League.

title: Top Norwegian experts warns against investment in petroleum exploration
byline: In the wake of the Sri Lankan government preparing for offshore petroleum exploration , a leading Norwegian expert in the field , said that it is a risky investment when the world is moving towards renewable energy sources more and more.

title: Suryakumar helps Mumbai crush Delhi to clinch playoff berth
byline: Suryakumar Yadav’s unbeaten 73 and a late blitz by Naman Dhir powered Mumbai Indians into the Indian Premier League playoffs with a 59-run hammering of Delhi Capitals on Wednesday.

title: Two Israeli embassy staffers killed in Washington shooting, suspect held
byline: Two Israeli embassy staff were killed in a shooting outside an event at the Capital Jewish Museum in Washington, DC, on Wednesday night, and a suspect is in custody, according to officials and media reports.

title: Poovarasankulam OIC arrested for soliciting Rs. 500,000 bribe
byline: The Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Poovarasankulam Police Station in Vavuniya has been arrested by the Bribery Commission for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 500,000.

title: CBSL further reduces Overnight Policy Rate
byline: The Monetary Policy Board has reduced the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) by 25 bps to 7.75% at its meeting held yesterday, thereby easing monetary policy further.

title: Men contribute more to rising infertility rates: Experts
byline: While both men and women play a role in infertility among young couples in Sri Lanka, men are seen as contributing more significantly to the problem.

title: Sri Lanka to unveil AI legislative roadmap in coming months
byline: Sri Lanka is set to release a comprehensive white paper outlining its legislative roadmap for artificial intelligence (AI) within the next two to three months, according to AI Advisory Committee Chairman Dr. Romesh Ranawana.

title: National consumer prices decline 0.8% in April on cut to petrol prices
byline: Prices could flip into inflationary territory in a month or two as expected by Central Bank

title: Sri Lanka battles surge in dengue, chikungunaya
byline: Health athuorities warn the public to stay alert as cases of dengue and chkiungunaya are increasing, driven by the current weather conditions that favour mosquito breeding.

title: Indian plane makes safe landing despite significant damage during hailstorm
byline: An Indian passenger jet that encountered a hailstorm mid-flight and left passengers terrified, made a safe landing, despite significant damage to the plane.

title: Suspended sentence imposed on Sakvithi, his wife
byline: Chandana Weerakumara, also known as Sakvithi Ranasinghe and his wife Kumari Anuradhani were convicted by Colombo High Court Judge Adithya Patabandige for operating a company in the Nugegoda area between November 1, 2006 and September 11, 2008, in violation of the Finance Companies Act.

title: Over 100 kgs of narcotics seized in Weeraketiya, two arrested
byline: Two suspects were arrested in Weeraketiya with over 100 kilograms of narcotics.

title: Stray dogs even in Parliament premises; Deputy Minister questions effectiveness of sterilisation
byline: Deputy Minister of Health Dr. Hansaka Wijemuni raised questions on the effectiveness of the sterilisation programmes, claiming that if the programme is successful, there cannot be stray dogs everywhere, even in Parliament.

title: Over 284,000 pregnancies in 2022: Health experts call for better infant care
byline: Sri Lanka has recorded a total of 284,008 pregnancies in 2022, reflecting 257,953 live births, the College of Community Physicians of Sri Lanka (CCPSL) said.

title: Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple to be declared a sacred site: Prime Minister
byline: The Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple is to be declared as a sacred site, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: Chamal has given Mahaweli lands to political acquaintances: SJB MP
byline: Former Minister Chamal Rajapaksa had given acres of Mahaweli lands to political acquaintances without any basis, SJB MP Hesha Vithanage alleged today.

title: Top Norwegian experts warn against investment in petroleum exploration
byline: In the wake of the Sri Lankan government preparing for offshore petroleum exploration , a leading Norwegian expert in the field , said that it is a risky investment when the world is moving towards renewable energy sources more and more.

title: British ’drugs mule’, 21, speaks from behind bars in Sri Lanka
byline: A young British woman facing years locked in a grim Sri Lankan jail after being caught with £1.2 million worth of cannabis has told of her despair – and insisted she has been set up.

title: Veterinary Association criticises Health Ministry for poorly managed sterilisation programmes
byline: The Association of Veterinarians for Humane Management of Animal Population has raised serious concerns about how the Health Ministry is running the country’s animal sterilisation programmes.

title: Cybersecurity firm Kaspersky uncovers sophisticated CEO impersonation scam
byline: Kaspersky has detected a series of targeted cyber attacks where fraudsters impersonated company CEOs to deceive finance departments into paying fake invoices. These sophisticated Business Email Compromise (BEC) attacks involved emails mimicking correspondence between executives and alleged contractor companies, urging urgent payments for ’’consulting services.’’

title: Five men smuggling Rs. 71 Mn worth Kush arrested at BIA
byline: Five local males attempting to smuggle in Kush worth Rs. 71.5 million from Bangkok were arrested by Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) last night.

title: Former Kundasale PS Chairman Asela Ekanayake granted bail
byline: Asela Ekanayake, the former Chairman of the Kundasale Pradeshiya Sabha, who was arrested today by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption, was released on bail today.

title: No more Prabakaran’s salt: Handunnetti tells Archchuna
byline: A heated argument erupted between Industries Minister Sunil Handunnetti and Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna in Parliament over the salt issue.

title: CSE up following CBSL policy rate cut and improved investor sentiment
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed on a positive note today, reflecting an overall optimistic market outlook.

title: Auditor General Dharmapala Gammanpila granted three months extension
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s request to allow incumbent Auditor General Dharmapala Gammanpila to remain in the post for six more months has been approved by the Constitutional Council (CC) today.

title: BOC, NSB record historic profits
byline: The Bank of Ceylon (BOC) and the National Savings Bank (NSB) reported record-breaking profits for the year 2024, the President’s Media Division said.

title: National cricketers’ writ petitions fixed for further hearing on May 28
byline: The writ petitions filed by Sri Lanka National Cricket players challenging the classification of Sri Lanka’s national cricketers as employees of the national association, Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) by the Inland Revenue Department (IRD) were today fixed for further hearing on May 28 by the Court of Appeal.

title: Supreme Court overturns PCoI findings against former Solicitor General
byline: The Supreme Court today quashed the findings, report and recommendations made by the Presidential Commission on Political Victimisation (PCoI) in relation to former Solicitor General Dilrukshi Dias Wickramasinghe, President’s Counsel.

title: Namal blames Govt for BOI apparel factory closure
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa criticized the government over the recent closure of an international apparel factory operating under the Board of Investment (BOI), citing it as yet another example of the administration’s failure to maintain a stable and supportive business environment.

title: Heavy rain disrupts life in several Indian cities
byline: Four people have reportedly died, with more than a dozen injured in the capital Delhi and nearby areas according to local media, after a severe hailstorm hit the city on Wednesday.

title: Harini meets UN Resident Coordinator to strengthen cooperation
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, met today with United Nations Resident Coordinator in Sri Lanka Marc-André Franche, at the Parliament, reaffirming the strong and enduring partnership between the Government of Sri Lanka and the United Nations system.

title: Injured female elephant treated at Siwalagama Forest Reservation
byline: A female elephant, believed to be around 25 years old, was found badly injured at the Siwalagama Forest Reservation, prompting an urgent response from wildlife and veterinary officers in the area.

title: BASL condemns attempts by authorities to breach attorney-client confidentiality
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) expressed deep concern over recent reports indicating attempts by Law Enforcement Agencies and Prosecuting Authorities to obtain information from Attorneys-at-Law related to their professional duties.

title: No threat from new COVID-19 variant: Health Ministry
byline: The Ministry of Health has reassured the public that there is no threat of a new COVID-19 variant spreading in Sri Lanka.

title: Lakmali Hemachandra appointed Chairperson of Sectoral Oversight Committee on Economic Development
byline: NPP MP Lakmali Hemachandra was appointed as the Chairperson of the Sectoral Oversight Committee on Economic Development and International Relations, the Communications Department of Parliament said.

title: Supreme Court rules police violated rights of Jehovah’s Witnesses women in 2014 arrest
byline: The Supreme Court ruled that the fundamental rights of four women affiliated to the Christian Congregation of Jehovah’s Witnesses were violated by the police during a 2014 arrest in the Walasmulla area.

title: Auditor General Dharmapala Gammanpila granted six months extension
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s request to allow incumbent Auditor General Dharmapala Gammanpila to remain in the post for six more months has been approved by the Constitutional Council (CC) today.
